Since you're building 2.6.2, the patches for 2.6.1 might be outdated and can be removed.
If this is to proposing the upgrade of Ambari, we can work on a patch to fix it.
If this is for custom distro. you're building privately, feel free to derive the desired versions and make the changes. You might need to remove/add patches for the versions that's not released by bigtop.

entry.title: Evans Ye commented on BIGTOP-3348 - Fix Hive test failures caused by NoSuchMethodError of ApplicationId.fromString
entry.summary:
OK. I think I get it now. Let me make an explicit case of this so that we can be more clear:
1. Tez depends on Hadoop 2.7.2
2. Hive depends on Tez
3. Hive has transitive dependency on Hadoop 2.7.2 because of Tez's dependency.

Now, CMIIW, your fix is

Read more
entry.content:
OK. I think I get it now. Let me make an explicit case of this so that we can be more clear:
1. Tez depends on Hadoop 2.7.2
2. Hive depends on Tez
3. Hive has transitive dependency on Hadoop 2.7.2 because of Tez's dependency.

Now, CMIIW, your fix is to exclude Hadoop 2.7.2 as transitive dependency in Hive, and then explicitly specify the correct dependency in Hive, which is 2.10.0.

What I was thinking is,

While modifying <hadoop.version>2.7.2</hadoop.version> in pom.xml of Tez worked, we can not fix already publicly available Tez artifact anyway.

There're two cases here:
1. Build Bigtop Hive with Bigtop Tez as dependency (point to a custom maven repository).
2. Build Bigtop Hive with ASF released Tez as dependency (point to public maven repository).

For 1, if we fix the pom.xml in Bigtop tez, then the Bigtop Hive will get the correct transitive dependency.
For 2, we can only fix it at Bigtop Hive side to make sure it gets correct dependency of Hadoop.

My conclusion:
The PR you posted fixes case 2, we should also fix the pom.xml in Tez so that it's using right Hadoop version for other packages that depends on Tez. Does this make sense?

activity:target.title: BIGTOP-3348
activity:target.summary: Fix Hive test failures caused by NoSuchMethodError of ApplicationId.fromString

entry.title: Evans Ye updated the Description of BIGTOP-3355 - [Puppet] Make GPG check for repos a configuration and default to true
entry.content: Currently Bigtop Puppet deploys repos w/o GPG check. This is insecure and need to be fixed. We can make GPG check a configuration and default to true. For testing purpose, one can set it to false to run w/ local repo or unsigned jenkins CI repo.

Masatake Iwasaki Thanks for the testing. Let me recap my understanding and make sure we're on the same page:

Edit hadoop ver in tez theoretically work. However in fact it does not. Maybe there's a bug on Tez side for specifying correct Hadoop version. As a result change on Tez side does not work. The PR you're posting is the way to fix it.

Am I getting it right?

entry.title: Evans Ye commented on BIGTOP-3348 - Fix Hive test failures caused by NoSuchMethodError of ApplicationId.fromString
entry.summary:
Alright I get the second point. Thanks for the explanation.

For the first point,

Since Bigtop does not publish Tez artifact...

You're right that currently Bigtop does not publish artifacts. Actually, AWS folk Mike Grimes has contributed the feature

Read more
entry.content:
Alright I get the second point. Thanks for the explanation.

For the first point,

Since Bigtop does not publish Tez artifact...

You're right that currently Bigtop does not publish artifacts. Actually, AWS folk Mike Grimes has contributed the feature of publishing artifacts to custom maven repo in BIGTOP-1227 w/ doc [1]. However only Hadoop and Hive are supported [2].

hadoop-2.7.2 is pulled as dependency of tez-0.9.2 from Maven repos on building Hive. We can only tweak transitive dependencies on build time.

I don't get it why 2.7.2 is still pulled. if we fix the hadoop version to 2.10.0 on Tez side, it should pull 2.10.0 jars on build time, and the pulled jars can be on man local or external repo(assume available). Again just let me know if I'm wrong. Thanks!

[1] https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/BIGTOP/Deploying+Build+Artifacts
[2] https://github.com/apache/bigtop/commit/ad6349c7d8885e347dfdf8a93c70acccc3efd8a0

activity:target.title: BIGTOP-3348
activity:target.summary: Fix Hive test failures caused by NoSuchMethodError of ApplicationId.fromString

entry.title: Evans Ye commented on BIGTOP-3348 - Fix Hive test failures caused by NoSuchMethodError of ApplicationId.fromString
entry.summary:
Masatake Iwasaki thanks for the explanation. I'm not quite sure I get it right so please just CMIIW:
1. If tez brings in wrong dependency, we should fix it on the tez side and not to bring in 2.7.2 jars. Bigtop as a distro. should all use 2.10.0

Read more
entry.content:
Masatake Iwasaki thanks for the explanation. I'm not quite sure I get it right so please just CMIIW:
1. If tez brings in wrong dependency, we should fix it on the tez side and not to bring in 2.7.2 jars. Bigtop as a distro. should all use 2.10.0 hadoop jars.
2. What do you meant by unittest time issue? Are you refering to smoke tests?

If Bigtop rpms/deb of Hive and Tez do not contain jars of hadoop-2.7.2, it is just unittest time issue.

i thought if we fix the it and rebuild all the rpm/deb packages, then smoke tests should pass as well.

Let me know if I'm wrong. Thanks!

activity:target.title: BIGTOP-3348
activity:target.summary: Fix Hive test failures caused by NoSuchMethodError of ApplicationId.fromString

entry.title: Evans Ye updated the Description of BIGTOP-3345 - Failed to run smoke test due to jenkins do not have permission to cleanup workspace
entry.summary:
Issue

ERROR: Failed to clean the workspace
jenkins.util.io.CompositeIOException: Unable to delete '/home/jenkins/workspace/Build-Deploy-Smoke-Test-Pull-Request-All-Distros/OS/centos-7-x86_64-deploy'. Tried 3 times (of a maximum of 3) waiting 0.1
Read more
entry.content:
Issue

ERROR: Failed to clean the workspace
jenkins.util.io.CompositeIOException: Unable to delete '/home/jenkins/workspace/Build-Deploy-Smoke-Test-Pull-Request-All-Distros/OS/centos-7-x86_64-deploy'. Tried 3 times (of a maximum of 3) waiting 0.1 sec between attempts.
	at jenkins.util.io.PathRemover.forceRemoveDirectoryContents(PathRemover.java:90)
	at hudson.Util.deleteContentsRecursive(Util.java:260)
	at hudson.Util.deleteContentsRecursive(Util.java:249)
	at org.jenkinsci.plugins.gitclient.CliGitAPIImpl$2.execute(CliGitAPIImpl.java:739)
	at org.jenkinsci.plugins.gitclient.RemoteGitImpl$CommandInvocationHandler$GitCommandMasterToSlaveCallable.call(RemoteGitImpl.java:161)
	at org.jenkinsci.plugins.gitclient.RemoteGitImpl$CommandInvocationHandler$GitCommandMasterToSlaveCallable.call(RemoteGitImpl.java:154)
	at hudson.remoting.UserRequest.perform(UserRequest.java:211)
	at hudson.remoting.UserRequest.perform(UserRequest.java:54)
	at hudson.remoting.Request$2.run(Request.java:369)
	at hudson.remoting.InterceptingExecutorService$1.call(InterceptingExecutorService.java:72)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
	Suppressed: java.nio.file.FileSystemException: /home/jenkins/workspace/Build-Deploy-Smoke-Test-Pull-Request-All-Distros/OS/centos-7-x86_64-deploy/bigtop-tests/smoke-tests/logger-test-config/build/resources/main/log4j.properties: Operation not permitted

Ref: https://ci.bigtop.apache.org/view/Test/job/Build-Deploy-Smoke-Test-Pull-Request-All-Distros/OS=centos-7-x86_64-deploy/52/consoleFull

Possible root cause

Guessing it's because the job error out early before the cleanup command getting executed:

./gradlew realclean docker-provisioner-destroy

Ref: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BIGTOP-3344

Possible solution

  • Small change: Run smoke test by jenkins instead of root.
  • Large change: Refactor the docker provisioner to eliminate unsafe root execution inside container.

activity:object.summary: Failed to run smoke test due to jenkins do not have permission to cleanup workspace

entry.title: Evans Ye created BIGTOP-3344 - Check-in Smoke Test CI script to the codebase
entry.summary:
The current smoke test script:

OS_WO_ARCH=`echo ${OS} | awk -F"-" '{ print $1"-"$2}'`
# clean up
case $(arch) in
    x86_64) IMAGE_SUFIX="";;
    *) IMAGE_SUFIX="-$(arch)";;
esac
docker run --rm -v `pwd`:/ws
Read more
entry.content:
The current smoke test script:

OS_WO_ARCH=`echo ${OS} | awk -F"-" '{ print $1"-"$2}'`
# clean up
case $(arch) in
    x86_64) IMAGE_SUFIX="";;
    *) IMAGE_SUFIX="-$(arch)";;
esac
docker run --rm -v `pwd`:/ws bigtop/slaves:trunk-${OS_WO_ARCH}${IMAGE_SUFIX} bash -c "cd /ws;git clean -xdf"

if [ ${COMPONENT} != "custom" ]; then
    echo "COMPONENT = ${COMPONENT}"
else
	COMPONENT=${CUSTOM_COMPONENT}
fi

if [ ${COMPONENT} != "skip" ]; then
	RUN_PACKAGING="allclean ${COMPONENT}-pkg-ind repo-ind"
    ENABLE_LOCAL_REPO_PROPERTY="-Penable_local_repo";
fi

if [ ! -z ${STACK} ]; then 
    RUN_PROVISIONER="docker-provisioner-destroy docker-provisioner"
    STACK_PROPERTY="-Pstack=${STACK}"; 
    NUM_INSTANCES_PROPERTY="-Pnum_instances=${NUM_INSTANCES}";
fi

if [ ! -z ${SMOKE_TESTS} ]; then 
    SMOKE_TESTS_PROPERTY="-Psmoke_tests=${SMOKE_TESTS}"; 
fi

# Apply patch
curl -L ${PR}.patch | git am

./gradlew ${RUN_PACKAGING} \
-POS=${OS_WO_ARCH} \
-Pprefix=${PREFIX} \
-Pconfig=config_${OS_WO_ARCH}.yaml \
${RUN_PROVISIONER} \
${ENABLE_LOCAL_REPO_PROPERTY} \
${NUM_INSTANCES_PROPERTY} \
${STACK_PROPERTY} \
${SMOKE_TESTS_PROPERTY} \
--info -s;

./gradlew realclean docker-provisioner-destroy

Jenkins job:
https://ci.bigtop.apache.org/view/Test/job/Build-Deploy-Smoke-Test-Pull-Request-All-Distros/

activity:object.title: BIGTOP-3344
activity:object.summary: Check-in Smoke Test CI script to the codebase

entry.title: Evans Ye commented on BIGTOP-3333 - Fix Hive build after upgrading Spark to 2.4.5
entry.summary:
Thanks for digging into it Kengo Seki. I understand your concern, but I think we can look for other distribution/cloud vendors as a reference as well.

  • EMR 5.X has Hive 2.3.6 with Spark 2.4.4

This indicates that the combination is somewhat reach

Read more
entry.content:
Thanks for digging into it Kengo Seki. I understand your concern, but I think we can look for other distribution/cloud vendors as a reference as well.

  • EMR 5.X has Hive 2.3.6 with Spark 2.4.4

This indicates that the combination is somewhat reach production grade.

Surely that they must have applied some internal fixes/patches to get them work. But I believe the work is not that much otherwise the risk will be high.

May I know what's the technical issue currently blocking us form integrating Spark 2.4, or you just want to be careful?

cc Jonathan Kelly would be great if you can provide some info

activity:target.title: BIGTOP-3333
activity:target.summary: Fix Hive build after upgrading Spark to 2.4.5

entry.title: Evans Ye created BIGTOP-3326 - Error out when docker image build failed
entry.summary:
Currently our docker image build script does not detect whether there's an error when building. The downside is when library download failed, there's no visibility on it and the image is still built and shipped. See BIGTOP-3224 as an example(MVN

Read more
entry.content:
Currently our docker image build script does not detect whether there's an error when building. The downside is when library download failed, there's no visibility on it and the image is still built and shipped. See BIGTOP-3224 as an example(MVN missing). We can:

1. Abort the docker build on non 0 EXEC
2. Post detect the build log and make remediation afterwards.

activity:object.title: BIGTOP-3326
activity:object.summary: Error out when docker image build failed

entry.title: Evans Ye commented on BIGTOP-3308 - Openssl fails to load in hadoop checknative -a on Debian 9
entry.summary:
Luca Toscano I use mac too and the core of Docker on Mac is still a hidden VM so I'm also experiencing the performance degradation as well.

Does 1.4 release strongly required by your org? We can discuss for that if there's a need. The reason we

Read more
entry.content:
Luca Toscano I use mac too and the core of Docker on Mac is still a hidden VM so I'm also experiencing the performance degradation as well.

Does 1.4 release strongly required by your org? We can discuss for that if there's a need. The reason we didn't do much backport n release in the past is there's no much user requirement sent in. From 1.4 RM point of view, we can do code release and skip those binary convenient artifacts. The effort should be much smaller than an entire release.

activity:target.title: BIGTOP-3308
activity:target.summary: Openssl fails to load in hadoop checknative -a on Debian 9

entry.content:
Kengo Seki I guess we both miss read Yuqi Gu's input. Let's take Yuqi Gu's concern into consideration because Bigtop is an open source distribution which should ship compatible big data stack as a whole.

Yuqi Gu Can that IGNITE-12247 patch work with Spark 2.4.5? It seems that in IGNITE-12054, other JIRAs are adding new features, therefore they're optional.

entry.title: Evans Ye commented on BIGTOP-3286 - Bump Ignite to 2.7.6
entry.summary:
Ignite 2.8 is not released yet: https://ignite.apache.org/download.cgi

Another way around is to patch ourself by applying that patch(es). However extra test is required. If we really need this I think ignite-spark smoke test should be added.

Yuqi

Read more
entry.content:
Ignite 2.8 is not released yet: https://ignite.apache.org/download.cgi

Another way around is to patch ourself by applying that patch(es). However extra test is required. If we really need this I think ignite-spark smoke test should be added.

Yuqi Gu just curious what's your use case for ignite spark?

activity:target.title: BIGTOP-3286
activity:target.summary: Bump Ignite to 2.7.6
